intro: Dasiphora gorovoii, commonly known as the Gorovoii goldenrod, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its bright yellow inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is known for its medicinal properties. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators. Its adaptability to arid environments makes it an important species in its native range.
